meanings.definition: To assert or lay down dogmatically
meanings.sent1: She dogmatizes her opinions without considering other viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The professor dogmatizes his theories as if they are the only truth.
meanings.sent3: He dogmatizes about the best way to make a sandwich, insisting on his method.
meanings.sent4: The politician dogmatizes his promises, but rarely follows through.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher dogmatizes the rules of the classroom, leaving no room for flexibility.

meanings.definition: To teach or assert in a dogmatic way
meanings.sent1: The preacher dogmatizes his beliefs to the congregation every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: She dogmatizes the importance of exercise to her students.
meanings.sent3: He dogmatizes about the benefits of eating broccoli, even though not everyone agrees.
meanings.sent4: The coach dogmatizes the team's strategy, expecting them to follow it without question.
meanings.sent5: The parent dogmatizes the rules of the house, expecting obedience from the children.
